noun.description: A word having a circumflex accent on the penultimate syllable.

adjective.description: Having a circumflex accent on the penultimate syllable.

origin: Mid 18th century. From Hellenistic Greek προπερισπώμενον word having a circumflex accent on the penultimate syllable, use as noun of neuter present participle passive of προπερισπᾶν to write or pronounce with a circumflex on the penultimate from ancient Greek προ- + περισπᾶν.
